sections.text: Prestige classes represent specializations not available to most adventurers, the culmination of extensive practice in a specific field or discipline. The eight prestige classes here supplement those found in Chapter 11 of the Core Rulebook. Always check with your GM to make sure a given prestige class is allowed before working toward it. The prestige classes presented in this chapter include the following.
sections.name: Prestige Classes

sections.text: A veteran whose masterful tactics and air of command inspire allies to greater feats of heroism.
sections.name: Battle Herald

sections.text: A pious warrior who spreads religion at the edge of a sword.
sections.name: Holy Vindicator

sections.text: A scout and wanderer comfortable in even the strangest terrain.
sections.name: Horizon Walker

sections.text: An alchemist whose mutagens create an alternate, brutish personality.
sections.name: Master Chymist

sections.text: An espionage expert specializing in disguises and striking swiftly from the shadows.
sections.name: Master Spy

sections.text: A master of the wilderness bonded spiritually to a fearsome animal companion.
sections.name: Nature Warden

sections.text: A bold and barbaric champion who embraces otherworldly powers in order to perfect the art of combat.
sections.name: Rage Prophet

sections.text: A master of defending territory and holding the line at all costs.
sections.name: Stalwart Defender

sections.text: Below are definitions of some common terms used here.
sections.name: Definition of Terms

sections.text: One of the standard eleven classes found in the Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook.
sections.name: Core Class

sections.text: A class that progresses from level 1–20.
sections.name: Base Class

sections.text: Generally equal to the number of class levels (see below) in a spellcasting class. Some prestige classes add caster levels to an existing class.
sections.name: Caster Level

sections.text: The sum of a character's class levels.
sections.name: Character Level

sections.text: The level of a character in a particular class.
sections.name: Class Level
